Comments_List: I learned about real-world case studies in which to apply ethics.

Pros: relaxed class, low workload, flexible hours for meeting
cons: not offered for yale credit, class material can be a bit unfocused at times.

It would be ideal if this course could be co-taught as a seminar by the Professor of Naval Science and another faculty member, such as someone from the law school, or the philosophy or political science departments, for credit. This is how the course was structured the class of 2019's first year and I think that it would allow for more dynamic and compelling conversations outside of the straightforward Navy curriculum.
Would be better if we could get into more ethical debates in class.
Not unless you need it for NROTC reqs.
Not unless you're a senior in NROTC.
